citation.article-title: Chitinophaga rupis sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Chitinophaga rupis sp. nov.
Chitinophaga rupis (ru′pis. L. fem. gen. n. rupis of a cliff, the location where the type strain was isolated.)
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, catalase- and oxidase-negative, non-motile rods (0.5–0.6×0.9–2.0 μm).
Colonies are circular, convex and sticky and deep yellow in colour.
Growth occurs at 20–37 °C, at pH 5.1–10.1 and with 1 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth does not occur at 10 or 42 °C, at pH 4.1 or 11.1 or with 2 % (w/v) NaCl.
Casein, DNA and starch are hydrolysed, but CM-cellulose and chitin are not.

With the API ZYM system, alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cysteine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosamidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are positive or weakly positive but esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), α-chymotrypsin and β-glucosidase are negative.

With the API 20NE system, indole production, aesculin degradation and β-galactosidase are positive but glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease and utilization of d-mannitol, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, gluconate, caprate, adipate, malate, citrate and phenylacetate are negative.

The following substrates are oxidized: α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, α-lactose, lactulose, maltose, d-mannose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, methyl pyruvate, acetic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, dl-lactic acid, l-alaninamide, l-alanyl glycine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, hydroxy l-proline, l-proline, glycerol and α-d-glucose 1-phosphate.

The following substrates are not oxidized: glycogen, adonitol, d-arabitol, i-erythritol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, d-psicose, d-sorbitol, xylitol, succinic acid monomethyl ester, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, formic acid, d-gluconic acid, β- and γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, glucuronamide, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-pyroglutamic acid, d-serine, l-serine, l-threonine, dl-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid, inosine, uridine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, α-dl-glycerol phosphate and d-glucose 6-phosphate (tested with the Biolog GN2 system).
Phosphatidylethanolamine, a ninhydrin-positive lipid and an unknown lipid are found as polar lipids.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, C18 : 0, C16 : 1ω5c and C16 : 0, with moderate amounts of iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and iso-C15 : 0 3-OH.
The type strain, CS5-B1T (=KCTC 22170T=DSM 21039T), was isolated from a soil sample collected from a cliff on Mara Island, south-west of Jeju, Republic of Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 48.7 mol%.
